text:
The oneform editor returns the error message: "Involved objects are checked out."

Steps to reproduce:
1. Log in to http://lenya.zones.apache.org:9999/index.html
2. Create a new publication or login to existing one.
3. Create new XHTML page, either Default Sample or Two Column Layout.
4. Go to Authoring mode. Click the new node, select Edit... with one Form
5. Click save.

You will be trapped in the error, there is no possibility of clicking your way out.

Local installation on Windows Vista, Lenya 2.0.x (zip src distribution), jdk1.6.0_05 with standard Jetty 5.1.4 shows the same behaviour.

Any ideas? Can anyone reproduce?

andreas@apache.org

creator: andreas@apache.org

text: When saving, executeUsecase() in usecases.js is called. Somehow the continuation isn't evaluated.
creator: andreas@apache.org

text: This issue should be fixed now. The difference between my local working copy and the Zones server is that I have enabled uploads. The source editor now shows an error message if uploads are disabled. Apart from that, the action attribute of the <form> element was missing, which caused an invalid processing of the form data, resulting in the "objects checked out" message.
creator: andreas@apache.org
matthijs@impressie.nl
text: After update, clean and compile it now works as expected. Thanks Andreas!
